DOCNAME: CASE OF CHERNOYVAN AND OTHERS v. RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-3 - Length of pre-trial detention;Reasonableness of pre-trial detention)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were prosecuted in GPE for various crimes . They were arrested and detained while the crimes were investigated and pending trial . Their detention was ordered and extended by the courts . The detention orders were essentially based on the gravity of the charges , the primary grounds being the risk of the applicants’ absconding and interfering with the course of justice . The detention and extension orders used stereotyped formulae , without addressing specific facts or considering alternative preventive measures .

He remained in custody while the crime was investigated and pending trial .
